title: Fishing Trawler

properties.name: description
properties.value: Fishing Trawler is a Fishing minigame run by Murphy in Port Khazard. It can be played at any level, but 15 Fishing is required to receive rewards. To play, board Murphy's trawling boat and work to prevent it from sinking for 5 minutes as it trawls the sea. This minigame can be done solo for higher non-unique rewards, but it is easier to obtain the angler's outfit working with others, especially on the official Fishing Trawler worlds.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Fishing TrawlerThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Fishing Trawler
 This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
This is a safe activity in an instanced area.
If you die here, you will not lose any of your items; however, any items you drop manually on the ground will be lost.
Warning: All PvM activities are dangerous for Hardcore group iron players, including Pest Control, Fight Caves, and Chambers of Xeric.
"Trawler" redirects here. For the music track, see Trawler (music track).
The official worlds for Fishing Trawler are worlds 315, 370 (P2P).
Fishing Trawler
Released 28 July 2003 (Update)
Type Minigame
Members Yes
Location Port Khazard
Participants 1+
Skills Fishing
Requirements None
15 Fishing to catch fish
Reward currency None
Tutorial None
Music Trawler Minor, Trawler
Location

Fishing Trawler is a Fishing minigame run by Murphy in Port Khazard. It can be played at any level, but 15 Fishing is required to receive rewards. To play, board Murphy's trawling boat and work to prevent it from sinking for 5 minutes as it trawls the sea. This minigame can be done solo for higher non-unique rewards, but it is easier to obtain the angler's outfit working with others, especially on the official Fishing Trawler worlds.

Starting a Fishing Trawler expedition is an easy Ardougne Diary task, while catching a manta ray, requiring 81 Fishing, and then cooking it in Port Khazard is an elite Ardougne Diary task.

Contents

  • 1 Getting there
  • 2 Playing
    • 2.1 Contribution
    • 2.2 Other information
  • 3 Rewards
    • 3.1 Uniques
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 References

Getting there[edit | edit source]

  • The Grouping teleport to Fishing Trawler, requiring 15 Fishing
  • The Khazard Teleport on the Lunar spellbook
  • The Charter ship destination of Port Khazard
  • The Ardougne cloak teleport to the Ardougne Monastery, then run south-east
  • Fairy ring code DJP, then run south
  • An Ardougne teleport or Watchtower teleport

Playing[edit | edit source]

Board the large ship directly north of Murphy and wait for the vessel to set sail. During the trip there are several activities that players can do to help defend and repair Murphy's ship. Leaks on the sides of the boat can be repaired using Swamp paste. If the leaks are not patched quickly enough, the ship will fill with water which must be bailed back into the sea with a bailing bucket. If the water level gets too high, the boat will sink and the players have to climb onto a barrel to return to shore north of Port Khazard. The fishing nets also occasionally get torn and must be repaired with rope. While the net is torn it will not catch fish and if it is not repaired before returning to the dock, no rewards will be given.[confirmation needed]

A kraken tentacle will also attack the ship's net and railings whilst slowing down the rate at which fish are caught. Fighting off the tentacle requires an axe (blessed axe does not work) and repairing damage to the ship's railings requires a hammer.

The amount of leaks, torn nets, and kraken encounters scale with the number of players on the trawler. In larger groups, 300 swamp paste, some rope, and at least one bailing bucket is recommended. All required items are available in Khazard General Store. There are also boxes containing bailing buckets, hammers, and bronze axes on the top deck of the ship.

Contribution[edit | edit source]

The contribution meter determines the reward given at the end of the minigame, increasing as more actions are performed up to the max of 255 points. Having a full contribution bar at the end of the minigame yields 50% more fish, and a greater chance at the heron pet. The contribution bar must be at or above 50 when the game ends for a chance to receive a piece of the Angler's outfit. The contribution bar does not deplete, therefore players are able to stop contributing after 50 points.

Actions that fill the contribution meter include:

  • Bailing water - 2 points
  • Repairing a leak with swamp paste - 5 points
  • Fixing the net with a rope - 7 points
  • Attacking the Kraken - 10 points
  • Fixing a broken railing caused by the Kraken - 10 points

Other information[edit | edit source]

  • Camera sway can be disabled by using the button in the top-right corner of the screen.
  • Swamp paste can be used and not have an effect when filling a hole at the same time as another player when the ship transitions between "empty" and "water-filled".
  • Round trip timing is as follows: 2x15 seconds arriving and departing, 5 minutes trawling, and 30–90 seconds for collecting rewards and banking before relaunching.
  • On populated worlds, players who miss the start of the minigame can wait on the boat and will be automatically added to the next fishing trip.
  • Difficulty fixing leaks in time can be helped by spam clicking between two tiles — going left to right — which increases the chance of patching either leak. Even if the leak is fixed before it is reached, as long as the animation happens, it is successful.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Upon successfully returning to the Port Khazard dock, players can inspect the trawler net for their reward of Fishing experience, salt water fish, and potentially pieces of the Angler's outfit. Fishing Trawler is one of only three places where raw sea turtles and raw manta rays can be obtained - the other two being drift net fishing, and Tempoross. Boosts cannot be used to obtain higher tier fish. Logging out will not cause the rewards to disappear. There is a bank chest just south of the trawler net.

Players are rewarded the number of fish equal to the "total catch" divided by the number of players in the minigame. The type of fish caught is dependent on the player's Fishing level, as shown in the chart below. Completing the elite Ardougne Diary yields 50% more fish and a full contribution meter also yields an additional 50% more fish. These fish include:

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Raw shrimpsVariesVaries563
Raw sardineVariesVaries426
Raw anchoviesVariesVaries679
OysterVariesVaries86120
Raw tunaVariesVaries5424
Raw lobsterVariesVaries15042
Raw swordfishVariesVaries31148
Raw sharkVariesVaries760102
Raw sea turtleVariesVaries824120
Raw manta rayVariesVaries1,348120

Players may also receive "junk" items in their trawler nets, all being equally likely. Independent of Fishing level, between 0 and 2 junk are caught every time, where the chance for 1 is about 37%, and the chance for 2 is about 16%.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Broken arrowVariesVariesNot sold0
Broken glassVariesVariesNot sold0
Broken staffVariesVariesNot sold0
ButtonsVariesVariesNot sold0
Damaged armourVariesVariesNot sold0
Old bootVariesVariesNot sold0
PotVariesVaries60
Rusty swordVariesVariesNot sold0

Uniques[edit | edit source]

There is a 1/12 chance[1] that players will receive a piece of the angler's outfit they do not already own if the player had at least 50 contribution points. When equipped, pieces of the outfit grant a small experience bonus while Fishing. If the player's inventory is full and they attempt to pick up an outfit piece, the outfit piece will fall on the ground. The chance for a piece does not scale with the contribution meter beyond the initial reward unlock threshold of 50 points. Owning the spirit angler's outfit allows the player to receive a new angler's outfit drop from the trawler.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Angler hat11/12[d 1]Not sold60
Angler top11/12[d 1]Not sold60
Angler waders11/12[d 1]Not sold60
Angler boots11/12[d 1]Not sold60
Heron11/5,000[d 2]Not soldN/A
  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 Will not drop once acquired.
  2. ^ Requires successful mini-game completion. Increased to 1/2500 with a full contribution meter.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 October 2021
(update)

It’s now easier to earn Contribution from bailing when the Fishing Trawler is very crowded.

5 May 2021
(update)

The information interface provided at the start of Fishing Trawler can now be toggled off or on by talking to Murphy on the boat in Port Khazard. You can also switch it straight off just by clicking "Do not show this again" on the interface itself.

28 April 2021
(update)
  • World 315 (US) has now become a designated Fishing Trawler activity world.
  • The trawler is now leakier when more players are on it. Stands to reason, right? However, more than one player can now fix a trawler railing at a time. Problem solved!
21 April 2021
(update)
  • Game duration has been halved, thus changed from 10 to 5 minutes.
  • In response to the changed game duration, the drop rate of Angler's Outfit pieces has been decreased to 1/12 from 1/8
  • The activity bar has been replaced with a contribution meter that does not deplete over time. You'll need a certain amount of contributions to start earning rewards
  • Two new activities related to the Kraken have been added
10 September 2020
(update)

An empty catch issue at the end of the minigame has been fixed.

15 August 2019
(update)
  • Leaky holes in the Fishing Trawler now allow more people to attempt to patch them simultaneously without giving dead clicks.
  • The minigame's timer has been corrected as it previously claimed the trip lasted 12 minutes, even though it was actually 10 minutes long.
  • The activity bar in Fishing Trawler will no longer decrease if there's nothing to do.
11 August 2016
(update)
  • An activity bar has been added to ensure everyone aboard is taking part in the minigame.
  • Ironmen can now access the minigame.
6 August 2015
(update)

Ironmen can now unlock the Fishing Trawler music tracks in order to attain the Music Cape.

26 November 2015
(update | poll)

A button has been added to the HUD of the Fishing Trawler minigame which allows the swaying camera movement to be disabled.

24 September 2015
(update)

You can no longer perform skillcape emotes aboard the Fishing Trawler.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

You now get 50% more fish from the Fishing Trawler minigame if you have completed the Ardougne Elite Diary.

5 March 2013
(update)

A bug has been fixed that was making the Fishing Trawler fail to fill with water properly when sinking.

22 February 2013
(update)
  • This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.
  • An issue with players being stuck on Fishing Trawler minigame has been fixed.
Date unknown

After an unknown update[which?], the Fishing Trawler was updated to stop people from using High Level Alchemy during the activity.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Attempting to bring a cat on the trawler while it is following the player or in the inventory yields the message: "You cannot take a cat out on the trawler. What if it were to fall in the sea?"
  • Attempting to bring any other follower that is following the player or in the inventory yields the message: "You cannot take that follower on the trawler. It might get wet."
  • If the Easter Ring or Snowman ring is equipped before the trawler sets sail, the player is shown in egg form or as a snowman during the sailing animation, with the egg or snowman floating in the middle of a black screen.
  • Attempting to use a Skillcape Emote on the boat before the trawler sets sail is blocked, yielding the message: "The boat movements put you off whilst trying to do your emote on the trawler. You feel a little sick."
  • When the Fishing Trawler had an activity meter, players that were inactive were kicked from the minigame and sent to the same location as if the boat sunk.
  • The Fishing Trawler is actually two instances that swap between each other. You can spot a flash on screen when this switch happens, every minute or so. Dropped items will disappear and then reappear as instances are swapped. Dropped items will also appear when reboarding the ship, assuming they have not despawned.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. "Fishing Trawler Improvements and Equipment Rebalance: Part One". 21 April 2021. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News.
